description: Canonical taxonomy of Virtual Power Plant dispatch strategies. This taxonomy separates decision mechanics, objectives, asset selection policies, and risk posture to enable composable, auditable dispatch behavior.

decision_framework.description: How dispatch decisions are computed over time.

deterministic_policy.description: Fixed or state-dependent rules. Predictable and auditable.

greedy_myopic.description: Optimizes immediate objective without long-horizon planning.

subtypes.best_efficiency_now: Maximize kW per unit of estimated cost

stochastic.description: Explicitly models uncertainty and expected distributions.

feedback_control.description: Closed-loop control using real-time error correction.

subtypes.error_correction: Adjust dispatch based on deviation from target

objective_function.description: What the strategy is optimizing for.

capacity.description: Maximize probability of meeting MW obligation.

risk_minimization.description: Minimize variance and probability of failure.

efficiency.description: Maximize value per unit of customer or asset cost.

regret_minimization.description: Avoid worst-case or reputationally damaging outcomes.

learning_oriented.description: Improve future dispatch by reducing uncertainty.

selection_and_ordering.description: How assets are selected and ordered for dispatch.

risk_posture.description: How aggressively the strategy trades risk for value.

deadline_aware.description: Aggressiveness increases as time remaining shrinks.

constraints.description: Hard and soft limits that dispatch must respect.

feedback_and_learning.description: How the system adapts during and after events.

closed_loop.description: Adjust dispatch based on observed performance.

post_event_learning.description: Update models and trust scores after events.

composition_rule.description: A complete dispatch strategy is defined by selecting exactly one decision framework, one objective function, one or more selection policies, one risk posture, and zero or more constraints and feedback mechanisms.
